column1: Smoque BBQ////I ordered the Brisket Platter
column2: and when I asked the cashier if she recommended it chopped or sliced
column3: she told me "sliced is best if you want it juicier and chopped is best if you like more of the smoky
column4: taste of the more cooked parts of the meat". She even offered for me to have 1/2 sliced and 1/2 chopped
column5: so I of course chose the variety. The brisket was some of the most delicious I have ever had
column6: and I would definitely recommend both. The two made in house BBQ sauces were fantastic as well (one was served with my friend's chicken and one was a special brisket sauce). I tried a bite of the chicken
column7: and it was extremely flavorful and balanced with its perfect smokey taste.
